table.name: node
table.description: Representation of an instance of SymmetricDS that synchronizes data with one or more additional nodes. Each node has a unique identifier (nodeId) that is used when communicating, as well as a domain-specific identifier (externalId) that provides context within the local system.

column.name: node_id
column.description: A unique identifier for a node.

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: The node group that this node belongs to, such as 'store'.

column.name: external_id
column.description: A domain-specific identifier for context within the local system. For example, the retail store number.

column.name: sync_enabled
column.description: Indicates whether this node should be sent synchronization. Disabled nodes are ignored by the triggers, so no entries are made in data_event for the node.

column.name: sync_url
column.description: The URL to contact the node for synchronization.

column.name: schema_version
column.description: The version of the database schema this node manages. Useful for specifying synchronization by version.

column.name: symmetric_version
column.description: The version of SymmetricDS running at this node.

column.name: database_type
column.description: The database product name at this node as reported by JDBC.

column.name: database_version
column.description: The database product version at this node as reported by JDBC.

column.name: heartbeat_time
column.description: The last timestamp when the node sent a heartbeat, which is attempted every ten minutes by default.

column.name: timezone_offset
column.description: The timezone offset in RFC822 format at the time of the last heartbeat.

column.name: batch_to_send_count
column.description: The number of outgoing batches that have not yet been sent. This field is updated as part of the heartbeat job.

column.name: batch_in_error_count
column.description: The number of outgoing batches that are in error at this node. This field is updated as part of the heartbeat job.

column.name: created_at_node_id
column.description: The node_id of the node where this node was created. This is typically filled automatically with the node_id found in node_identity where registration was opened for the node.

table.name: node_security
table.description: Security features like node passwords and open registration flag are stored in the node_security table.

column.name: node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a node.

column.name: node_password
column.description: The password used by the node to prove its identity during synchronization.

column.name: registration_enabled
column.description: Indicates whether registration is open for this node. Re-registration may be forced for a node if this is set back to '1' in a parent database for the node_id that should be re-registred.

column.name: registration_time
column.description: The timestamp when this node was last registered.

column.name: initial_load_enabled
column.description: Indicates whether an initial load will be sent to this node.

column.name: initial_load_time
column.description: The timestamp when this node started the initial load.

column.name: created_at_node_id
column.description: The node_id of the node where this node was created. This is typically filled automatically with the node_id found in node_identity where registration was opened for the node.

table.name: node_identity
table.description: After registration, this table will have one row representing the identity of the node. For a root node, the row is entered by the user.

column.name: node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a node.

table.name: node_group
table.description: A category of Nodes that synchronizes data with one or more NodeGroups. A common use of NodeGroup is to describe a level in a hierarchy of data synchronization.

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a node group, usually named something meaningful, like 'store' or 'warehouse'.

column.name: description
column.description: A description of this node group.

table.name: node_group_link
table.description: A source node_group sends its data updates to a target NodeGroup using a pull, push, or custom technique.

column.name: source_node_group_id
column.description: The node group where data changes should be captured.

column.name: target_node_group_id
column.description: The node group where data changes will be sent.

column.name: data_event_action
column.description: The notification scheme used to send data changes to the target node group. (P = Push, W = Wait for Pull)

table.name: node_host
table.description: Representation of an physical workstation or server that is hosting the SymmetricDS software. In a clustered environment there may be more than one entry per node in this table.

column.name: node_id
column.description: A unique identifier for a node.

column.name: host_name
column.description: The host name of a workstation or server. If more than one instance of SymmetricDS runs on the same server, then this value can be a 'server id' specified by -Druntime.symmetric.cluster.server.id

column.name: ip_address
column.description: The ip address for the host.

column.name: os_user
column.description: The user SymmetricDS is running under

column.name: os_name
column.description: The name of the OS

column.name: os_arch
column.description: The hardware architecture of the OS

column.name: os_version
column.description: The version of the OS

column.name: available_processors
column.description: The number of processors available to use.

column.name: free_memory_bytes
column.description: The amount of free memory available to the JVM.

column.name: total_memory_bytes
column.description: The amount of total memory available to the JVM.

column.name: max_memory_bytes
column.description: The max amount of memory available to the JVM.

column.name: java_version
column.description: The version of java that SymmetricDS is running as.

column.name: java_vendor
column.description: The vendor of java that SymmetricDS is running as.

column.name: symmetric_version
column.description: The version of SymmetricDS running at this node.

column.name: timezone_offset
column.description: The timezone offset in RFC822 format at the time of the last heartbeat.

column.name: heartbeat_time
column.description: The last timestamp when the node sent a heartbeat, which is attempted every ten minutes by default.

column.name: last_restart_time
column.description: Timestamp when this instance was last restarted.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: node_id
column.description: A unique identifier for a node.

column.name: host_name
column.description: The host name of a workstation or server. If more than one instance of SymmetricDS runs on the same server, then this value can be a 'server id' specified by -Druntime.symmetric.cluster.server.id

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The channel_id of the channel that data changes will flow through.

column.name: data_routed
column.description: Indicate the number of data rows that have been routed during this period.

column.name: data_event_inserted
column.description: Indicate the number of data rows that have been routed during this period.

column.name: node_id
column.description: A unique identifier for a node.

column.name: host_name
column.description: The host name of a workstation or server. If more than one instance of SymmetricDS runs on the same server, then this value can be a 'server id' specified by -Druntime.symmetric.cluster.server.id

column.name: restarted
column.description: Indicate that a restart occurred during this period.

column.name: node_id
column.description: A unique identifier for a node.

column.name: host_name
column.description: The host name of a workstation or server. If more than one instance of SymmetricDS runs on the same server, then this value can be a 'server id' specified by -Druntime.symmetric.cluster.server.id

table.name: channel
table.description: This table represents a category of data that can be synchronized independently of other channels. Channels allow control over the type of data flowing and prevents one type of synchronization from contending with another.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: A unique identifer, usually named something meaningful, like 'sales' or 'inventory'.

column.name: processing_order
column.description: Order of sequence to process channel data.

column.name: max_batch_size
column.description: The maximum number of Data Events to process within a batch for this channel.

column.name: max_batch_to_send
column.description: The maximum number of batches to send during a 'synchronization' between two nodes. A 'synchronization' is equivalent to a push or a pull. If there are 12 batches ready to be sent for a channel and max_batch_to_send is equal to 10, then only the first 10 batches will be sent.

column.name: max_data_to_route
column.description: The maximum number of data rows to route for a channel at a time.

column.name: extract_period_millis
column.description: The minimum number of milliseconds allowed between attempts to extract data for targeted at a node_id.

column.name: enabled
column.description: Indicates whether channel is enabled or not.

column.name: use_old_data_to_route
column.description: Indicates whether to read the old data during routing.

column.name: use_row_data_to_route
column.description: Indicates whether to read the row data during routing.

column.name: use_pk_data_to_route
column.description: Indicates whether to read the pk data during routing.

column.name: contains_big_lob
column.description: Provides SymmetricDS a hint as to whether this channel will contain big lobs data. Some databases have shortcuts that SymmetricDS can take advantage of if it knows that the lob columns in sym_data aren't going to contain large lobs. The definition of how big a 'large' lob is will differ from database to database.

column.name: batch_algorithm
column.description: The algorithm to use when batching data on this channel. Possible values are: 'default', 'transactional', and 'nontransactional'

column.name: description
column.description: Description on the type of data carried in this channel.

table.name: node_channel_ctl
table.description: Used to ignore or suspend a channel. A channel that is ignored will have its data_events batched and they will immediately be marked as 'OK' without sending them. A channel that is suspended is skipped when batching data_events.

column.name: node_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a node.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The name of the channel_id that is being controlled.

column.name: suspend_enabled
column.description: Indicates if this channel is suspended, which prevents its Data Events from being batched.

column.name: ignore_enabled
column.description: Indicates if this channel is ignored, which marks its Data Events as if they were actually processed.

column.name: last_extract_time
column.description: Record the last time data was extract for a node and a channel.

table.name: node_group_channel_window
table.description: An optional window of time for which a node group and channel will be active.

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: The node_group_id that this window applies to.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The channel_id that this window applies to.

column.name: start_time
column.description: The start time for the active window.

column.name: end_time
column.description: The end time for the active window. Note that if the end_time is less than the start_time then the window crosses a day boundary.

column.name: enabled
column.description: Enable this window. If this is set to '0' then this window is ignored.

table.name: trigger
table.description: Configures database triggers that capture changes in the database. Configuration of which triggers are generated for which tables is stored here. Triggers are created in a node's database if the source_node_group_id of a router is mapped to a row in this table.

column.name: trigger_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a trigger.

column.name: source_catalog_name
column.description: Optional name for the catalog the configured table is in.

column.name: source_schema_name
column.description: Optional name for the schema a configured table is in.

column.name: source_table_name
column.description: The name of the source table that will have a trigger installed to watch for data changes.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The channel_id of the channel that data changes will flow through.

column.name: sync_on_update
column.description: Whether or not to install an update trigger.

column.name: sync_on_insert
column.description: Whether or not to install an insert trigger.

column.name: sync_on_delete
column.description: Whether or not to install an delete trigger.

column.name: sync_on_incoming_batch
column.description: Whether or not an incoming batch that loads data into this table should cause the triggers to capture data_events. Be careful turning this on, because an update loop is possible.

column.name: name_for_update_trigger
column.description: Override the default generated name for the update trigger.

column.name: name_for_insert_trigger
column.description: Override the default generated name for the insert trigger.

column.name: name_for_delete_trigger
column.description: Override the default generated name for the delete trigger.

column.name: sync_on_update_condition
column.description: Specify a condition for the update trigger firing using an expression specific to the database.

column.name: sync_on_insert_condition
column.description: Specify a condition for the insert trigger firing using an expression specific to the database.

column.name: sync_on_delete_condition
column.description: Specify a condition for the delete trigger firing using an expression specific to the database.

column.name: external_select
column.description: Specify a SQL select statement that returns a single result. It will be used in the generated database trigger to populate the EXTERNAL_DATA field on the data table.

column.name: tx_id_expression
column.description: Override the default expression for the transaction identifier that groups the data changes that were committed together.

column.name: excluded_column_names
column.description: Specify a comma-delimited list of columns that should not be synchronized from this table. Note that if a primary key is found in this list, it will be ignored.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: router
table.description: Configure a type of router from one node group to another. Note that routers are mapped to triggers through trigger_routers.

column.name: router_id
column.description: Unique description of a specific router

column.name: target_catalog_name
column.description: Optional name for the catalog a target table is in. Only use this if the target table is not in the default catalog.

column.name: target_schema_name
column.description: Optional name of the schema a target table is in. On use this if the target table is not in the default schema.

column.name: target_table_name
column.description: Optional name for a target table. Only use this if the target table name is different than the source.

column.name: source_node_group_id
column.description: Routers with this node_group_id will install triggers that are mapped to this router.

column.name: target_node_group_id
column.description: The node_group_id for nodes to route data to. Note that routing can be further narrowed down by the configured router_type and router_expression.

column.name: router_type
column.description: The name of a specific type of router. Out of the box routers are 'default','column','bsh', and 'subselect.' Custom routers can be configured as extension points.

column.name: router_expression
column.description: An expression that is specific to the type of router that is configured in router_type. See the documentation for each router for more details.

column.name: sync_on_update
column.description: Flag that indicates that this router should route updates.

column.name: sync_on_insert
column.description: Flag that indicates that this router should route inserts.

column.name: sync_on_delete
column.description: Flag that indicates that this router should route deletes.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: trigger_router
table.description: Map a trigger to a router.

column.name: trigger_id
column.description: The id of a trigger.

column.name: router_id
column.description: The id of a router.

column.name: initial_load_order
column.description: Order sequence of this table when an initial load is sent to a node.

column.name: initial_load_select
column.description: Optional expression that can be used to pair down the data selected from a table during the initial load process.

column.name: ping_back_enabled
column.description: When enabled, the node will route data that originated from a node back to that node. This attribute is only effective if sync_on_incoming_batch is set to 1.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: parameter
table.description: Provides a way to manage most SymmetricDS settings in the database.

column.name: external_id
column.description: Target the parameter at a specific external id. To target all nodes, use the value of 'ALL.'

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: Target the parameter at a specific node group id. To target all groups, use the value of 'ALL.'

column.name: param_key
column.description: The name of the parameter.

column.name: param_value
column.description: The value of the parameter.

table.name: registration_redirect
table.description: Provides a way for a centralized registration server to redirect registering nodes to their prospective parent node in a multi-tiered deployment.

column.name: registrant_external_id
column.description: Maps the external id of a registration request to a different parent node.

column.name: registration_node_id
column.description: The node_id of the node that a registration request should be redirected to.

table.name: registration_request
table.description: Audits when a node registers or attempts to register.

column.name: node_group_id
column.description: The node group that this node belongs to, such as 'store'.

column.name: external_id
column.description: A domain-specific identifier for context within the local system. For example, the retail store number.

column.name: status
column.description: The current status of the registration attempt. Valid statuses are NR (not registered), IG (ignored), OK (sucessful)

column.name: host_name
column.description: The host name of a workstation or server. If more than one instance of SymmetricDS runs on the same server, then this value can be a 'server id' specified by -Druntime.symmetric.cluster.server.id

column.name: ip_address
column.description: The ip address for the host.

column.name: attempt_count
column.description: The number of registration attempts.

column.name: registered_node_id
column.description: A unique identifier for a node.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_by
column.description: The user who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: trigger_hist
table.description: A history of a table's definition and the trigger used to capture data from the table. When a database trigger captures a data change, it references a trigger_hist entry so it is possible to know which columns the data represents. trigger_hist entries are made during the sync trigger process, which runs at each startup, each night in the syncTriggersJob, or any time the syncTriggers() JMX method is manually invoked. A new entry is made when a table definition or a trigger definition is changed, which causes a database trigger to be created or rebuilt.

column.name: trigger_hist_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a trigger_hist entry

column.name: trigger_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a trigger

column.name: source_table_name
column.description: The name of the source table that will have a trigger installed to watch for data changes.

column.name: source_catalog_name
column.description: The catalog name where the source table resides.

column.name: source_schema_name
column.description: The schema name where the source table resides.

column.name: name_for_update_trigger
column.description: The name used when the insert trigger was created.

column.name: name_for_insert_trigger
column.description: The name used when the update trigger was created.

column.name: name_for_delete_trigger
column.description: The name used when the delete trigger was created.

column.name: table_hash
column.description: A hash of the table definition, used to detect changes in the definition.

column.name: trigger_row_hash
column.description: A hash of the trigger definition. If changes are detected to the values that affect a trigger definition, then the trigger will be regenerated.

column.name: column_names
column.description: The column names defined on the table. The column names are stored in comma-separated values (CSV) format.

column.name: pk_column_names
column.description: The primary key column names defined on the table. The column names are stored in comma-separated values (CSV) format.

column.name: last_trigger_build_reason
column.description: The following reasons for a change are possible: New trigger that has not been created before (N); Schema changes in the table were detected (S); Configuration changes in Trigger (C); Trigger was missing (T).

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: inactive_time
column.description: The date and time when a trigger was inactivated.

table.name: data
table.description: The captured data change that occurred to a row in the database. Entries in data are created by database triggers.

column.name: data_id
column.description: Unique identifier for a data.

column.name: table_name
column.description: The name of the table in which a change occurred that this entry records.

column.name: event_type
column.description: The type of event captured by this entry. For triggers, this is the change that occurred, which is 'I' for insert, 'U' for update, or 'D' for delete. Other events include: 'R' for reloading the entire table (or subset of the table) to the node; 'S' for running dynamic SQL at the node, which is used for adhoc administration.

column.name: row_data
column.description: The captured data change from the synchronized table. The column values are stored in comma-separated values (CSV) format.

column.name: pk_data
column.description: The primary key values of the captured data change from the synchronized table. This data is captured for updates and deletes. The primary key values are stored in comma-separated values (CSV) format.

column.name: old_data
column.description: The captured data values prior to the update. The column values are stored in CSV format.

column.name: trigger_hist_id
column.description: The foreign key to the trigger_hist entry that contains the primary key and column names for the table being synchronized.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The channel that this data belongs to, such as 'prices'

column.name: transaction_id
column.description: An optional transaction identifier that links multiple data changes together as the same transaction.

column.name: source_node_id
column.description: If this data was capture

column.name: external_data
column.description: A field that can be populated by a trigger that uses the EXTERNAL_SELECT

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

table.name: data_ref
table.description: Used only when routing.data.reader.type is set to 'ref.' Table that tracks the last known data_id that has been processed. This table is used so that joins to find unprocessed data can be better optimized.

column.name: ref_data_id
column.description: The data_id that can be used to limit the search of the data table to rows that are greater than this data_id value.

column.name: ref_time
column.description: The time when the ref_data_id was recorded. It is used as the base time to calculate timeouts for gaps in the data_ids.

table.name: data_gap
table.description: Used only when routing.data.reader.type is set to 'gap.' Table that tracks gaps in the data table so that they may be processed efficiently, if data shows up. Gaps can show up in the data table if a database transaction is rolled back.

column.name: start_id
column.description: The first missing data_id from the data table where a gap is detected. This could be the last data_id inserted plus one.

column.name: end_id
column.description: The last missing data_id from the data table where a gap is detected. If the start_id is the last data_id inserted plus one, then this field is filled in with a -1.

column.name: status
column.description: GP, SK, or FL. GP means there is a detected gap. FL means that the gap has been filled. SK means that the gap has been skipped either because the gap expired or because no database transaction was detected which means that no data will be committed to fill in the gap.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

column.name: last_update_hostname
column.description: The host who last updated this entry.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a user last updated this entry.

table.name: data_event
table.description: Represents routing of a data row to one or more nodes. Entries in data_event are created by database triggers.

column.name: data_id
column.description: Id of the data to be routed.

column.name: batch_id
column.description: The node_id of the node that is to receive the data.

column.name: router_id
column.description: The router_id of the router that routed this data_event.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

table.name: outgoing_batch
table.description: Used for tracking the sending a collection of data to a node in the system. A new outgoing_batch is created and given a status of 'NE'. After sending the outgoing_batch to its target node, the status becomes 'SE'. The node responds with either a success status of 'OK' or an error status of 'ER'. An error while sending to the node also results in an error status of 'ER' regardless of whether the node sends that acknowledgement.

column.name: batch_id
column.description: A unique id for the batch.

column.name: node_id
column.description: The node that this batch is targeted at.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The channel that this batch is part of.

column.name: status
column.description: The current status of the Batch can be newly created (NE), sent to a Node (SE), acknowledged as successful (OK), and error (ER).

column.name: load_flag
column.description: A flag that indicates that this batch is part of an initial load.

column.name: error_flag
column.description: A flag that indicates that this batch was in error during the last synchornization attempt.

column.name: byte_count
column.description: The number of bytes that were sent as part of this batch.

column.name: extract_count
column.description: The number of times this an attempt to extract this batch occurred.

column.name: sent_count
column.description: The number of times this batch was sent. A batch can be sent multiple times if an ACK is not received.

column.name: load_count
column.description: The number of times an attempt to load this batch occurred.

column.name: data_event_count
column.description: The number of data_events that are part of this batch.

column.name: reload_event_count
column.description: The number of reload events that are part of this batch.

column.name: insert_event_count
column.description: The number of insert events that are part of this batch.

column.name: update_event_count
column.description: The number of update events that are part of this batch.

column.name: delete_event_count
column.description: The number of delete events that are part of this batch.

column.name: other_event_count
column.description: The number of other event types that are part of this batch. This includes any events types that are not a reload, insert, update or delete event type.

column.name: router_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent creating this batch.

column.name: network_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent transfering this batch across the network.

column.name: filter_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent in filters processing data.

column.name: load_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent loading the data into the target database.

column.name: extract_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent extracting the data out of the source database.

column.name: sql_state
column.description: For a status of error (ER), this is the XOPEN or SQL 99 SQL State.

column.name: sql_code
column.description: For a status of error (ER), this is the error code from the database that is specific to the vendor.

column.name: sql_message
column.description: For a status of error (ER), this is the error message that describes the error.

column.name: failed_data_id
column.description: For a status of error (ER), this is the data_id that was being processed when the batch failed.

column.name: last_update_hostname
column.description: The host name of the process that last did work on this batch.

column.name: last_update_time
column.description: Timestamp when a process last updated this entry.

column.name: create_time
column.description: Timestamp when this entry was created.

table.name: incoming_batch
table.description: The incoming_batch is used for tracking the status of loading an outgoing_batch from another node. Data is loaded and commited at the batch level. The status of the incoming_batch is either successful (OK) or error (ER).

column.name: batch_id
column.description: The id of the outgoing_batch that is being loaded.

column.name: node_id
column.description: The node_id of the source of the batch being loaded.

column.name: channel_id
column.description: The channel_id of the batch being loaded.

column.name: status
column.description: The current status of the Batch can be successfully loaded (OK) or error (ER).

column.name: network_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent transfering this batch across the network.

column.name: filter_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent in filters processing data.

column.name: database_millis
column.description: The number of milliseconds spent loading the data into the target database.

column.name: failed_row_number
column.description: For a status of error (ER), this is the data_id that was being processed when the batch failed.

column.name: byte_count
